questions.question: What is the purpose of a transaction log in a database?
options: To record all changes made to the database
questions.correct_answer: To record all changes made to the database

questions.question: Which isolation level ensures that no dirty reads, non-repeatable reads, or phantom reads occur?
questions.correct_answer: Serializable

questions.question: What is the purpose of a materialized view in a database?
options: To store the result of a query for faster access
questions.correct_answer: To store the result of a query for faster access

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to grant privileges to a user?
questions.correct_answer: GRANT

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CASCADE option in a foreign key constraint?
options: To automatically delete related rows in child tables
questions.correct_answer: To automatically delete related rows in child tables

questions.question: What is the difference between composition and inheritance in OOP?
options: Composition is a 'has-a' relationship, while inheritance is an 'is-a' relationship
Composition is an 'is-a' relationship, while inheritance is a 'has-a' relationship
Composition is used for polymorphism, while inheritance is used for encapsulation
Composition is used for encapsulation, while inheritance is used for polymorphism
questions.correct_answer: Composition is a 'has-a' relationship, while inheritance is an 'is-a' relationship

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in Java?
options: To refer to the current instance of the class
To refer to the parent class
To refer to a static method
To refer to a global variable
questions.correct_answer: To refer to the current instance of the class

questions.question: What is method overloading in OOP?
options: Defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
Redefining a method in a subclass
Creating a method with no parameters
Using the same method name in different classes
questions.correct_answer: Defining multiple methods with the same name but different parameters

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'final' keyword in Java?
options: To prevent a class from being inherited
To allow a method to be overridden
questions.correct_answer: To prevent a class from being inherited

questions.question: What is the difference between an abstract class and an interface in Java?
options: An abstract class can have both abstract and concrete methods, while an interface can only have abstract methods
An interface can have both abstract and concrete methods, while an abstract class can only have abstract methods
An abstract class is used for polymorphism, while an interface is used for inheritance
An interface is used for polymorphism, while an abstract class is used for inheritance
questions.correct_answer: An abstract class can have both abstract and concrete methods, while an interface can only have abstract methods

questions.question: What is the time complexity of a binary search algorithm?
questions.correct_answer: O(log n)

questions.question: What is the purpose of a hash function in data structures?
options: To map data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values
To sort data in ascending order
questions.correct_answer: To map data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values

questions.question: What is the difference between a stack and a queue?
options: A stack is LIFO, while a queue is FIFO
A stack is FIFO, while a queue is LIFO
A stack is used for sorting, while a queue is used for searching
A stack is used for searching, while a queue is used for sorting
questions.correct_answer: A stack is LIFO, while a queue is FIFO

questions.question: What is the purpose of a binary tree in data structures?
options: To sort data in linear time
questions.correct_answer: To store hierarchical data

questions.question: What is the worst-case time complexity of quicksort?
What is the purpose of dynamic programming in algorithms?
options: To solve problems by breaking them into smaller subproblems
To sort data in linear time
questions.correct_answer: To solve problems by breaking them into smaller subproblems

questions.question: What is the time complexity of the Floyd-Warshall algorithm?
What is the purpose of the A* algorithm?
options: To find the shortest path in a graph
To sort data in linear time
questions.correct_answer: To find the shortest path in a graph

questions.question: What is the difference between BFS and DFS?
options: BFS uses a queue, while DFS uses a stack
BFS uses a stack, while DFS uses a queue
BFS is used for sorting, while DFS is used for searching
BFS is used for searching, while DFS is used for sorting
questions.correct_answer: BFS uses a queue, while DFS uses a stack

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Dijkstra algorithm?
options: To find the shortest path in a weighted graph
To sort data in linear time
questions.correct_answer: To find the shortest path in a weighted graph
